New Records: Aaron Ashby hit 99 mph on the stadium radar gun.
William Contreras stole home for the first time in his professional career.
Key Match Events: Aaron Civale cleared seven innings for the first time this season and didn’t allow a run.
The Brewers stole a run with aggressive baserunning in a victory that boosted the Brewers to 5-1-1 in their last seven series.
Pre-Game Insights: Brewers manager Pat Murphy emphasized the importance of the team's competitive spirit and ability to keep competing.
Post-Match Reflections: William Contreras expressed the team's focus and unity.
Aaron Ashby reflected on his journey back to health and his current role in the bullpen.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers moved to 21 games over.500 and pulled within one game of the Phillies for the league’s second-best record.
The top two division winners in each league earn a first-round bye in the postseason.
Others: The Brewers added a half-game on the idle Cubs and lead the division by 9 1/2 games with 29 to go.
